alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Chatham; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Alamance, east central Randolph and western Chatham Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Siler City, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail and localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Siler City, Liberty, Staley, Snow Camp, Harpers Crossroads, Coleridge, Hasty, Sutphin and Saxapahaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
